snippet: In “New York and Los Angeles: The Uncertain Future,” two sociology professors examine the demographic, political, economic and cultural forces shaping the country’s two biggest metropolitan areas.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books New York and Los Angeles: The Uncertain Future by Andrew A Beveridge and David Halle and new bilingual edition of Federico Garcia Lorca book Poet in New York.
lead_paragraph: In “New York and Los Angeles: The Uncertain Future,” two sociology professors examine the demographic, political, economic and cultural forces shaping the country’s two biggest metropolitan areas.

headline.seo: Books Examine Outlook for New York and L.A., and Lorca’s Legacy
